-c.description: Format the code passed in as a string.

-l.description: How many characters per line to allow. [default: 88]

-t.description: Python versions that should be supported by Black's output...

--pyi.description: Format all input files like typing stubs regardless of file extension.

--ipynb.description: Format all input files like Jupyter Notebooks regardless of file extension.

-x.description: Skip the first line of the source code.

-S.description: Don't normalize string quotes or prefixes.

-C.description: Don't use trailing commas as a reason to split lines.

--unstable.description: Enable potentially disruptive style changes that have known bugs... Implies --preview.

--check.description: Don't write the files back, just return the status...

--diff.description: Don't write the files back, just output a diff...

--color.description: Show colored diff. Only applies when --diff is given.

--no-color.description: Do not show colored diff. Only applies when --diff is given.

--fast.description: Turns off AST safety check after formatting.

--exclude.description: A regular expression that matches files and directories that should be excluded... [default: /.../].

--extend-exclude.description: Like --exclude, but adds additional files and directories on top of the default values...

--force-exclude.description: Like --exclude, but files matching this regex will be excluded even when passed explicitly...

--include.description: A regular expression that matches files and directories that should be included... [default: (.pyi?|.ipynb)$]

-W.description: Controls the number of parallel workers... Defaults to the number of CPUs.

-v.description: Emit messages about files that were not changed or were ignored...

--config.description: Read configuration options from a configuration file.

SRC.name: SRC
SRC.description: Source code file(s) or directory(s) to format.
